−
'''Morality''' (from the [[Latin]] ''{{Lang|la|moralitas}}'' "manner, character, proper behavior") is the differentiation among intentions, decisions, and [[Social actions|actions]] between those that are good (or right) and bad (or wrong). A ''moral code'' is a system of morality (for example, according to a particular [[philosophy]], [[religion]], [[culture]], etc.) and a ''moral'' is any one practice or teaching within a moral code. The [[adjective]] ''moral'' is synonymous with "good" or "right." ''Immorality'' is the active opposition to morality (i.e. good or right), while ''amorality'' is variously defined as an unawareness of, indifference toward, or disbelief in any set of moral standards or principles.<ref>
+
'''Morality''' (from the [[Latin]] ''{{Lang|la|moralitas}}'' "manner, character, proper behavior") is the differentiation among intentions, decisions, and [[Social actions|actions]] between those that are judged or defined as good (or right) and those that are judged or defined as bad (or wrong). A ''moral code'' is a system of morality (for example, according to a particular [[philosophy]], [[religion]], [[culture]], etc.) and a ''moral'' is any one practice or teaching within a moral code. The [[adjective]] ''moral'' is synonymous with "good" or "right." ''Immorality'' is the active opposition to morality (i.e. good or right), while ''amorality'' is variously defined as an unawareness of, indifference toward, or disbelief in any set of moral standards or principles.<ref>
